definition: Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a molecule type. This should be used for direct detection of the molecule, whether it is a small molecule or a peptide.
Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a gene type. This should be used for detection of RNAs that code for proteins which may or may not have been detected directly.

notes: not entirely sure if we need this one

definition: Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a morphological phenotype concept. This should be used when a neuron type is described using a high level morphological concept class.

Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and an electrophysiological phenotype concept. This should be used when a neuron type is described using a high level electrophysiological concept class.
Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a developmental cell population. This should be used when a neuron develops from an identified developmental cell population.
label: needs work

definition: Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a brain region that said neuron type sends axons to.
notes: this might be clearer  than hasCircuitRole… but might confuse with projectsTo or the like…, excitatory/inhibitory shouldn't be handled here?

definition: Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a laminer brain region.
Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a brain region or brain parcel. This is a superProperty and should not be used directly.
Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a species. This should be used when a neuron type has been observed in a specific species.
Expresses a relationship between a neuron type and a taxon. This should be used when a neuron type is thought to have been present in the last common ancestor of the taxon.
notes: isAncestralInTaxon (because convergent evolution is SOOO likely…)

definition: Expresses a relationship between a phenotype and a brain region. This should be used when a neuron phenotype is observed in specific brain regions.
Expresses a relationship between a phenotype and a phenotype. This should be used when two phenotypes commonly cooccure.
notes: this is not the right way to pull this off, need something akin to disjointness
this seems to be more about developmental stage, except that it used used for brain… maybe blastulas don't count?
